meaningMnemonic:
When you're <kanji>distract</kanji>ed, everything you do is a <vocabulary>fluke</vocabulary>. You're not focusing, so it all comes down to <vocabulary>chance</vocabulary>.

Note that this word is mostly written in kana only!
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. This uses a different reading than the one you've already learned, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

Somebody was trying to <reading>mug</reading> (まぐ) you, but you managed to escape by pure <vocabulary>chance</vocabulary>! Your escape might have just been a <vocabulary>fluke</vocabulary>, but at least you didn't get mugged!
